content.raw: The broker currently only sends data messages using its ignition node, and a client created with \_useIgnition=false advertises ros services instead of issuing an ignition endpoint register request, so the broker will receive data from the clients but the clients cannot receive data from the broker.  Using \_useIgnition=true seems to work other than issue [#143](#!/osrf/subt/issues/143/subt-commsclient-cant-handle-ros) regarding ros namespaces. Not sure if this is really an issue, other than the default of the parameter is false so the client is therefor broken by default and it’s not obvious to the user why without digging into the subt broker code.
